text:
Whenever I try to load test with JMeter against our site (https), it fails at 
our forms based authentication page (j_security_check).  However, if I remove 
the forms based authentication, and change to basic authentication, JMeter has 
no problems getting in.  The later is a workaround, but it's not what we wish 
to test against.

The server that I'm testing against is running JBoss2.44/Tomcat3.2.3 through 
Apache2.0.44.  Apache handles the certificate for SSL (which I placed a copy of 
the public cert into CACERTS).

Any help on this would be great.
creator: dbrown@pingtel.com

text:
Explain what you mean by form auth and basic auth in detail.  Also, are other
pages working under https?
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
When using SSL you are challenged for a user name and password when you log on 
to a secure site, providing it's setup in the web.xml file (we are using 
Tomcat).  One of the ways to be challanged is with Basic Authentication( maybe 
I should use the term Authorization), where the browser will popup a dialog 
box requesting username and password.  If you wish to create your own login 
screen, you need to specify that it is forms based.  And in the case of Tomcat 
the fields are j_username and j_password...both of which are posted to 
j_security_check.
